preclusion: LL4395/LL5395/LL6395 The Law & Practice of Modern Trust Structures
description:
Using precedents and transactional documents generously supplied by various leading law firms and chambers, the module will examine in much greater depth various representative uses of trusts in the modern world, both to make family provision and in commerce. It will examine how these functions are realised by practising lawyers working within, ad developing, legal doctrine. Finally it will
explore the broad theoretical implications of this work.
title: The Law & Practice of Modern Trust Structures
prerequisite:
NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
LC2006 Equity & Trusts
